disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Friday 8 April to end of Friday 8 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A rather cool-feeling day for Friday as a northerly air feed arrives in Greater London. This incoming air will though be relatively 'clean' and carry little by way of imported pollution. Although winds will be light throughout the day, there should be enough air movement to prevent the build-up of local emissions. <br/><br/>Overall air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 9 April to end of Saturday 9 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Following a cold start to the weekend, temperatures are forecast to warm up by Monday.  Saturday is expected to be mainly dry with some sun in parts.<br/><br/>A continuing northerly air feed to Greater London should be relatively 'clean' and carry little by way of imported pollution. There should also be enough air movement to prevent the build-up of local emissions. <br/><br/>Overall air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
